Constructor Detail

MongoDatastore

public MongoDatastore()
Constructs a MongoDatastore using the default database name of "test" and defaults for the host and port. Typically used during testing.

MongoDatastore

public MongoDatastore(MongoMappingContext mappingContext, java.util.Map connectionDetails, MongoOptions mongoOptions, ConfigurableApplicationContext ctx)
Constructs a MongoDatastore using the given MappingContext and connection details map.
Parameters:
mappingContext - The MongoMappingContext
connectionDetails - The connection details containing the MONGO_HOST and MONGO_PORT settings

MongoDatastore

public MongoDatastore(MongoMappingContext mappingContext, java.util.Map connectionDetails, ConfigurableApplicationContext ctx)

mappingContext - The MongoMappingContext
connectionDetails - The connection details containing the MONGO_HOST and MONGO_PORT settings

MongoDatastore

public MongoDatastore(MongoMappingContext mappingContext, Mongo mongo, ConfigurableApplicationContext ctx)
Constructor for creating a MongoDatastore using an existing Mongo instance
Parameters:
mappingContext - The MappingContext
mongo - The existing Mongo instance

MongoDatastore

public MongoDatastore(MongoMappingContext mappingContext, Mongo mongo, java.util.Map connectionDetails, ConfigurableApplicationContext ctx)
Constructor for creating a MongoDatastore using an existing Mongo instance. In this case the connection details are only used to supply a USERNAME and PASSWORD
Parameters:
mappingContext - The MappingContext
mongo - The existing Mongo instance
